Class CollisionEvent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--CollisionEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CollisionEvent
extends java.lang.Throwable

This exception is thrown whenever any two particles collide. In it's constructor it automatically calculates the new object which is created, conserving mass and momentum.

See Also:
Serialized Form

 int index2
          The index of the second object in the collision.

          The first object in the collision
 Part part2
          The second object in the collision
 Part result
          The object resulting from the merger of the above two.
